name: 2004 Tony Awards Online Quiz | Theatre | 20 Questions

questions.text: Who won for "Best Orchestrations"?
questions.explanation:
Michael Starobin.

	Michael Starobin did the orchestrations for "Assassins". This was his first Tony Award.

questions.text: Who won the Tony for "Best Choreography"?
questions.explanation:
Kathleen Marshall.

	Kathleen Marshall won for "Wonderful Town". This was her first Tony Award. She was also nominated for "Best Direction in a Musical".

questions.text: Who won for "Best Direction of a Musical"?
questions.explanation:
Joe Mantello.

	Joe Mantello directed "Assassins". This is his second Tony Award. He won for "Best Direction of a Play" in 2003 for the play "Take Me Out".

questions.text: Who won for "Best Costume Design"?
questions.explanation:
Susan Hilferty.

	Susan Hilferty won for "Wicked". This was her first Tony Award.

questions.text: Who won for "Best Scenic Design"?
questions.explanation:
Eugene Lee.

	Eugene Lee won for "Wicked". This is his third Tony Award. He won in 1974 for "Best Scenic Design" for "Candide" and again in 1979 for "Best Scenic Design" for "Sweeny Todd".

questions.text: Who won for "Best Performance by a Featured Actress in a Musical"?
questions.explanation:
Anika Noni Rose.

	Anika Noni Rose won for her role in "Caroline, or Change". This was her first Tony Award.

questions.text: Who won for "Best Performance by a Featured Actor in a Musical"?
questions.explanation:
Michael Cerveris.

	Michael Cerveris won for "Assassins". This is his first Tony Award.

questions.text: Who won for "Best Performance by a Featured Actress in a Play"?
questions.explanation:
Audra McDonald.

	Audra McDonald won for her role in "A Raisin in the Sun". This is her fourth Tony Award. She has also won for "Best Featured Actress in a Musical" for "Carousel" in 1994, "Best Featured Actress in a Play" for "Master Class" in 1996, and "Best Featured Actress in a Musical" for "Ragtime".

questions.text: Who won for "Best Performance by a Featured Actor in a Play"?
questions.explanation:
Brian F. O'Byrne

	Brian F. O'Byrne won for "Frozen".

questions.text: Who won the Tony for "Best Performance by a Leading Actress in a Musical"?
questions.explanation:
Idina Menzel.

	Idina Menzel won for "Wicked." This is her first Tony, although she was nominated for "Rent" in 1996 where she played Maureen.

questions.text: Who won for "Best Performance by a Leading Actor in a Musical"?
questions.explanation:
Hugh Jackman.

	Hugh Jackman won for "The Boy from Oz". This was his first Tony Award.

questions.text: Who won for "Best Performance by a Leading Actress in a Play"?
questions.explanation:
Phylicia Rashad.

	Phylicia Rashad won for "A Raisin in the Sun". This is her first Tony Award.

questions.text: Who won for "Best Performance by an Leading Actor in a Play"?
questions.explanation:
Jefferson Mays.

	Jefferson Mays won for "I Am My Own Wife". This was his first Tony Award.

questions.text: What show won for "Best Revival of a Musical"?
questions.explanation:
Assassins.

	"Assassins" was written by Stephen Sondheim.  It opened on Broadway on April 22, 2004. It won 6 of the 8 Tony Awards it was nominated for.

questions.text: What show won for "Best Revival of a Play"?
questions.explanation:
Henry IV.

	"Henry IV" was written by William Shakespeare. It won 2 out of the 6 Tony Awards it was nominated for.

questions.text: Who won for "Best Original Score"?
questions.explanation:
Robert Lopez and Jeff Marx.

	Lopez and Marx won for "Avenue Q". This is the first Tony Award for both.

questions.text: Who won for "Best Original Book of a Musical"?
questions.explanation:
Jeff Whitty.

	Jeff Whitty won for "Avenue Q". It was his first Tony Award.

questions.text: Which show won for "Best Musical"?
questions.explanation:
Avenue Q.

	"Avenue Q" opened on Broadway on July 31, 2003. It uses puppets as well as people. It features many great songs including "The Internet is for Porn" and of course the title song "Avenue Q". It won 3 out of 6 awards.

questions.text: What show won for "Best Play"?
questions.explanation:
I Am My Own Wife.

	"I Am My Own Wife" opened on Broadway on December 3, 2003. It is a one man show starring Jefferson Mays. Mays plays 40 characters in the show. It won 2 out of 3 Tony Awards. It also won a Pulitzer Prize for Drama.

questions.text: Who presented the award for "Best Musical" along with Sarah Jessica Parker?
questions.explanation:
Nathan Lane.

	Nathan Lane is in the movie remake of "The Producers" with Sarah Jessica Parker's husband Matthew Broderick. They have also done Broadway shows together.
